author: Lisa Jeeves-2015-08-18T07:43:42-0400
title: 3 Quirky Experiences in London
text:
18, 2015 
A centrally based London hotel is the perfect starting point for some quirky adventures in one of the world’s greatest cities. 
As one of the greatest cities in the world, there’s no end to the amazing and fascinating sights and experiences London has to offer. In fact, whether it’s a first visit or they’ve been here dozens of times, most visitors never lose the excitement they feel after checking into their London hotel and contemplating the new adventures that await them. 
If you’re looking for the unusual attractions of the city around your London hotel, below we present a few experiences and sights a little out of the ordinary. They say the best souvenir one can take home is an exciting story, and these attractions are definitely something to talk about! 
L 
If trapeze artists have always fascinated you, here’ 
If you want to see more of the city but just aren’t in the mood for stuffy tours full of facts and dates, check out Bullshit Tours, which bills itself as a company that holds 'factually inaccurate walking tours.' During this two-hour tour, the tour-guide duo (comedians in real life) make jokes, tell tall tales, and spout fallacies regarding various landmarks in the city, including the Thames and Trafalgar Square. Held annually since 1966, the Notting Hill Carnival is not just any street party; it’ 
Other events include a Grand Parade, a family-friendly Children’s Day celebration, and numerous concerts and performances. Be sure to book your London hotel room early, as this is one of the city’s most popular events, attracting thousands of Londoners and visitors alike. Additional tip: Certain roads will be closed for the parade so make sure your chosen London hotel is walking distance from the celebrations.
